00021 /**
00022  * @file   GenoSeedTxt.cpp
00023  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00024  * @date   Fri Jun 30 17:31:22 2006
00025  * 
00026  * @brief Implements interface for a genotyping oracle used for
00027  * genotyping seeds in brlmm. In this case the genotype seed calls are
00028  * simply read from a text file.
00029  * 
00030  */
00031 
00032 //
00033 #include "chipstream/GenoSeedTxt.h"
00034 //
00035 #include "file/TsvFile/TsvFile.h"
00036 #include "util/Fs.h"
00037 
00038 using namespace std;
00039 using namespace affx;
00040 
00041 /** 
00042  * Open up a text file and read the genotypes from it. The chrX
00043  * snps will be used to determine the het call rate on chrX. If
00044  * supplied.
00045  * 
00046  * @param fileName - Name of text file to read genotypes from.
00047  * @param layout - Physical description of chip and probesets.
00048  * @param chrXSnps - Which snps are on chrX.
00049  */
00050 GenoSeedTxt::GenoSeedTxt(const std::string& fileName, ChipLayout &layout, 
00051                          std::vector<std::string> &colName,
00052                          std::map<std::string,bool> &chrXSnps) {
00053   m_ChipCount = 0;
00054   readInPrecompGenoTypes(fileName, colName, chrXSnps);
00055 
00056   m_GenderName = "supplied-genotypes-chrX-het-rate";
00057   m_GenderDescription = "chrX het rates from supplied genotypes";
00058   
00059 }
00060 
00061 /** 
00062  * Read in the precomputed genotypes from a tab delimited file. Must
00063  * be a column for each Celfile with same header name as celfile and an row
00064  * for every snp to be analyzed. There can be extra columns and order of columns
00065  * is not important as the resulting order will be the same as the colNames
00066  * vector.
00067  * 
00068  * @param fileName - path to text file to read genotypes from.
00069  * @param colNames - Name of the columns we're expecting to find in this file.
00070  * @param gtypes - Map to store the genotypes in.
00071  */
00072 void GenoSeedTxt::readInPrecompGenoTypes(const std::string& fileName, 
00073                                          std::vector<std::string> &colNames,
00074                                          std::map<std::string,bool> &chrXSnps) {
00075   int i;
00076   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00077   m_ChipCount = colNames.size();
00078   vector<GType> calls(colNames.size());
00079   vector<int> intCalls(colNames.size(), -1);
00080 //  vector<uint64_t> hetChrxCalls(colNames.size(), 0);
00081 //  vector<uint64_t> hetChrxPossibleCalls(colNames.size(), 0);
00082 //  vector<uint64_t> madeCalls(colNames.size(), 0);
00083 //  vector<uint64_t> possibleCalls(colNames.size(), 0);
00084   //
00085   vector<uint32_t> hetChrxCalls(colNames.size(), 0);
00086   vector<uint32_t> hetChrxPossibleCalls(colNames.size(), 0);
00087   vector<uint32_t> madeCalls(colNames.size(), 0);
00088   vector<uint32_t> possibleCalls(colNames.size(), 0);
00089   
00090   string probeset;
00091   m_KnownCalls.clear();
00092   /* Expecting one column for the id and one for each cel file. */
00093   tsv.bind(0,"probeset_id", &probeset, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00094   Verbose::out(1, "Reading in seed genotypes from " + ToStr(fileName));
00095   if(tsv.open(fileName) != TSV_OK) {
00096     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + ToStr(fileName) + " to read.");
00097   }
00098   // Read CEL/sample column names from hints file
00099   int columnCount = tsv.getColumnCount(0);
00100   std::set<std::string> hintSampleNames;
00101   for (i = 1; i < columnCount; i++) { // i = 0 : probeset_id
00102     hintSampleNames.insert(tsv.getColumnName(0, i));
00103   }
00104   // compare hints file column names to CELfile names
00105   std::string basename;
00106   for(i = 0; i < colNames.size(); i++) {
00107     basename = Fs::basename(colNames[i]);
00108     if (hintSampleNames.find(basename) != hintSampleNames.end()) {
00109       tsv.bind(0, basename.c_str(), &intCalls[i], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);        
00110     }
00111     else {
00112       Verbose::out(3, "Couldn't find hints for " + basename + " in file " + fileName);
00113     }
00114   }
00115 
00116   m_KnownCalls.clear();
00117   while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00118     map<string,bool>::iterator iter = chrXSnps.find(probeset);
00119     bool isChrX = (iter != chrXSnps.end() && iter->second == true);
00120     if(m_KnownCalls.find(probeset) != m_KnownCalls.end()) {
00121       Err::errAbort("Found probeset: " + probeset + " specified multiple times in file: " + ToStr(fileName));
00122     }
00123     
00124     /* convert to char as tsv doesn't bind char. */
00125     for(uint32_t i = 0; i < intCalls.size(); i++) {
00126       // this converts -1 to NN, 0 to AA, 1 to AB, 2 to BB
00127       calls[i] = GType_from_int(intCalls[i]);
00128       /* keep track of call rate. */
00129       possibleCalls[i]++;
00130       if(calls[i] != NN) {
00131         madeCalls[i]++;
00132       /* keep track of het rate on chrx for gender determination. */
00133         if(isChrX) {
00134           hetChrxPossibleCalls[i]++;
00135           if(calls[i] == AB) {
00136             hetChrxCalls[i]++;
00137           }
00138         }
00139       }
00140     }
00141     m_KnownCalls[probeset] = calls;
00142   }
00143   /* Calculate and save our per chip call rates and het rate on chrX */
00144   m_CallRates.clear();
00145   m_HetChrXCallRates.clear();
00146   for(size_t chipIx = 0; chipIx < m_ChipCount; chipIx++) {
00147     float callRate = (float) madeCalls[chipIx]/possibleCalls[chipIx];
00148     m_CallRates.push_back(callRate);
00149     if(hetChrxPossibleCalls[chipIx] > 0) {
00150       float hetCalls = (float) hetChrxCalls[chipIx] / hetChrxPossibleCalls[chipIx];
00151       m_HetChrXCallRates.push_back(hetCalls);
00152     }
00153     else {
00154       m_HetChrXCallRates.push_back(-1);
00155     }
00156   }
00157   tsv.close();
00158 }
